This is a list of experimental features that you can enable. These features are still under development; they are not fully tested, and might reduce EUR-Lex stability. Don't forget to give your feedback! Warning! Experimental feature conflicts detected. Replacement of CELEX identifiers by short titles - experimental feature. It replaces clickable CELEX identifiers of treaties and case-law by short titles. Visualisation of document relationships. name: auth-direct-access.html
text: your feedback! Warning! Experimental feature conflicts detected. Replacement of CELEX identifiers by short titles - experimental feature. It replaces clickable CELEX identifiers of treaties and case-law by short titles. Visualisation of document relationships. It displays a dynamic graph with relations between the act and related documents. It is currently only available for legal acts. Deep linking. It enables links to other legal acts referred to within the documents. It is currently only available for documents smaller than 900 KB. Append an asterisk ( * ) to a search term to find variations of it (transp * , 32019R * ). Use a question mark ( ? ) instead of a single character in your search term to find variations of it (ca ? e finds case, cane, care). Search tips Need more search options? text: question mark ( ? ) instead of a single character in your search term to find variations of it (ca ? e finds case, cane, care). Search tips Need more search options? Use the Advanced search Help Export PDF Print Access the Official Journal Official Journal L series daily view Official Journal C series daily view Browse the Official Journal Legally binding printed editions Special editions Official Journal - Legally binding printed editions Since 1 July 2013 (the date Regulation No 216/2013 entered into force), only the electronic editions of the Official Journal are authentic and produce legal effects. However, if the information systems are affected by an unforeseen and exceptional disruption, it may not be possible to publish the electronic edition of an Official Journal on EUR-Lex. In this case, the edition concerned is published in printed form. This printed edition is authentic and produces legal effects. Since the entry into force of Regulation No 2024/741 on 14 March 2024, such printed edition is considered authentic until the systems are restored and the corresponding electronic edition is made available on EUR-Lex. From that moment on, only the electronic edition is considered authentic. Three printed editions of the Official Journal

name: auth-direct-access.html
text: entry into force of Regulation No 2024/741 on 14 March 2024, such printed edition is considered authentic until the systems are restored and the corresponding electronic edition is made available on EUR-Lex. From that moment on, only the electronic edition is considered authentic. Three printed editions of the Official Journal had authentic status between 1 July 2013 and the entry into force of Regulation No 2024/741 . Since 14 March 2024, only the corresponding electronic editions published on EUR-Lex are considered authentic and produce legal effects.
